#Text=2. Methods
#Text=2.1. Materials and Experimental Setup

#Text=The analysis of APT network attack packets is not new technology , but it has become an essential part of network administrators and information security and is used to analyze regular activities .
#Text=In the past , it usually applied to the analysis of network behavior or debugging of the network environment .
#Text=In the current network milieu , where information security incidents are frequent , this investigation has become regular and essential .
#Text=Side recording of network packets from a target host can provide information about events that enables even more information to be obtained through analysis .

#Text=Therefore , while facing current popular APT attacks hidden behind communication behavior , and even in the communication content , it is possible to obtain key information by using network packet analysis technology .

#Text=In this study , a comparison has been made between the correct rate of APT network attack detection using the NSL-KDD data sets and PCA dimensionality reduction technology and four machine learning classification algorithms : SVM , naive Bayes , decision tree , and the multi-layer perceptron neural network ( MLP ) .

#Text=Most relevant work has been done using the “ WEKA Spreadsheet to ARFF ” service to convert the NSL-KDD data set format from files with the csv extension to ARFF extension format ( including “ training data set ( KDDTrain+ ) ” and “ test data set ( KDDTest+ ) ” ( https://github.com/jmnwong/NSL-KDD-Dataset ) is the reference URL .
#Text=Because the data has different ranges , preprocessing needed to be done to round up all the features .
#Text=Two type classifiers were used , normal , and anomaly .
#Text=The PCA algorithm was then used to reduce the size of the classified data set .
#Text=Finally , the pre-processed training and test data sets were grouped and tested , and experiments with the four classification algorithms were carried out .
#Text=These were SVM , naive Bayes , decision tree , and MLP and they were used to train and test the data and compare and analyze the results .
#Text=Each record had data with 41 different feature attributes presenting the content of the network packets .
#Text=There were four categories of anomalous attack
#Text=DoS , Probe , R2L , and U2R and the definitions are shown in Table 1 .
#Text=2.2.
#Text=Method of Signal Dimension Reduction
#Text=PCA is a statistical technique that transforms a set of possible correlation variables to a set of linearly uncorrelated variables by orthogonal transformation .
#Text=The transformed set of variables is the principal component .
#Text=A set of related features in high-dimensional data is converted to a smaller subset and named as principal component .
#Text=High-dimensional data can be transformed to low-order dimension data ( ) .
#Text=PCA does this transformation by finding a feature vector , and projecting the dimension data onto that feature vector to minimize the overall projection error .
#Text=PCA can preserve around 0.9 variance of the original data set and significantly reduce the number of features as well as the dimensions .
#Text=The original high-dimensional data set is projected onto a smaller subspace while preserving most of the information contained in the original data set .
#Text=Assuming , and , the random dimension with the mean ( ) inputs the data recording its definition as ( 1 ) ( 1 )
#Text=The definition f the covariance matrix of is ( 2 ) : ( 2 )
#Text=PCA solves the eigenvalues problem of Covariance matrix ( 3 )
#Text=In Equation ( 3 ) , is the eigenvalue and is the corresponding eigenvector .

#Text=To represent the data record with a low-dimensional vector , only pieces of eigenvector ( named as the principal direction ) are needed , corresponding to pieces of the largest eigenvalue ( ) , and the variance of the projection of the input data in the principal direction is greater than the variance in any other direction .
#Text=Hence parameter is the approximate precision of the pieces of the largest eigenvector , so the following relationship ( 4 ) is obtained ( 4 )

#Text=The purpose of PCA is to maximize internal information and increase calculation speed after dimension reduction , and to evaluate the importance of the direction by the size of the data variance in the projection direction .
